articles.headline: Potluck for the Eyeballs: Amazon’s Streaming Service
articles.snippet: Amazon challenges Netflix in the streaming-movie arena with a free service. Well, it’s free with the purchase of an Amazon Prime membership.
articles.abstract: Amazon challenges Netflix in the streaming-movie arena with a free service. Well, it’s free with the purchase of an Amazon Prime membership.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the olden days, bargains added spice to life. You’d get a free toaster with a new bank account, or a collectible drinking glass with a gas fill-up. Old-timers even claim that at one time, you got free meals on airplanes.

articles.headline: Homeowners See Benefits in Bank Plan
articles.snippet: More than 130,000 people have benefited – mostly through short sales – in the first stage of relief promised by five banks in settling allegations of foreclosure abuses.
articles.abstract: More than 130,000 people have benefited – mostly through short sales – in the first stage of relief promised by five banks in settling allegations of foreclosure abuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than 130,000 homeowners have received $10.5 billion in relief under the national settlement over foreclosure abuses, according to a preliminary report issued Wednesday by the settlement monitor.

articles.headline: Syrian Émigrés Seek Aid in U.S. to Arm Rebels
articles.snippet: A network of activists has organized a nonprofit group in Washington to help Syria’s insurgents buy weapons, and it is already affecting American policy.
articles.abstract: A network of activists has organized a nonprofit group in Washington to help Syria’s insurgents buy weapons, and it is already affecting American policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From a one-room office in an unfinished glass tower three blocks from the White House, an amorphous network of activists is doing what the Obama administration will not: attempting to arm the rebels trying to overthrow Syria’s government.

articles.headline: Prosecutors Link Money From China to Iran
articles.snippet: Prosecutors say they found evidence that banks may have been flouting United States sanctions against Iran.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors say they found evidence that banks may have been flouting United States sanctions against Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say they have unearthed evidence in recent international money-transfer investigations that Chinese banks may have flouted United States sanctions against Iran.

articles.headline: GSV Capital, Placing Bets on Start-Ups, Falters
articles.snippet: GSV, the largest of several closed-end mutual funds that offer ordinary investors a chance to own stakes in privately held companies, has been hit particularly hard by Facebook’s troubles.
articles.abstract: GSV, the largest of several closed-end mutual funds that offer ordinary investors a chance to own stakes in privately held companies, has been hit particularly hard by Facebook’s troubles.
articles.lead_paragraph: Few investors have ridden the recent Internet boomlet like the GSV Capital Corporation.

articles.headline: Rousing G.O.P., Ryan Faults ‘Missing’ Leadership
articles.snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan accepted the Republican nomination for vice president as his party embraced the gamble that his principles offer more political payoff than peril.
articles.abstract: Representative Paul D. Ryan accepted the Republican nomination for vice president as his party embraced the gamble that his principles offer more political payoff than peril.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, whose budget plans have come to define conservative opposition to President Obama’s governing philosophy, accepted the Republican vice-presidential nomination on Wednesday as his party embraced the gamble that the small-government principles he represents have more political payoff than peril.

articles.headline: Defeat, Introspection, Reinvention, Nomination
articles.snippet: For three years after his failed 2008 presidential campaign, Mitt Romney sought to reclaim his public identity with the self-critical eye, marketing savvy and systematic rigor of the corporate consultant that he once was.
articles.abstract: For three years after his failed 2008 presidential campaign, Mitt Romney sought to reclaim his public identity with the self-critical eye, marketing savvy and systematic rigor of the corporate consultant that he once was.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Not long after Mitt Romney dropped out of the presidential race in early 2008, a titan of New York finance, Julian H. Robertson, flew to Utah to deliver an eye-popping offer.

articles.headline: Barclays Picks One of Its Own as Chief
articles.snippet: Signaling a return to its British banking roots, Barclays has appointed an insider, Antony Jenkins, as chief executive, as the bank aims to restore its reputation after a rate-manipulation scandal.
articles.abstract: Signaling a return to its British banking roots, Barclays has appointed an insider, Antony Jenkins, as chief executive, as the bank aims to restore its reputation after a rate-manipulation scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: 8:27 p.m. | Updated Barclays, which has been tarnished by scandal, appointed a new chief executive on Thursday, as the British bank looks to restore its reputation and overhaul its culture.
